The 'Kingdom of the Netherlands' (}} ; ), commonly known as the 'Netherlands',
is a sovereign state and constitutional monarchy with territory in Western
Europe and in the Caribbean. The four parts of the kingdomAruba, CuraÃ§ao, the
Netherlands, and Sint Maartenare referred to as countries and participate on a
basis of equality as partners in the kingdom. The Charter of the Kingdom was
fully explained in an âEXPLANATORY MEMORANDUM to the Charter for the Kingdom of
the Netherlandsâ, transmitted to the U.N. Secretary-General in compliance with
the wishes expressed in General Assembly resolutions 222 (III) and 747 (VIII).
New York, 30 March 1955(* Ministerie van Buitenlandse Zaken , 41, Suriname en de
Nederlandse Antillen in de Verenigde Naties III, Staatsdrukkerij-en
uitgeversbedrijf/ âs Gravenhage, 1956) In practice, however, most of the
kingdom affairs are administered by the Netherlands (which comprises roughly 98%
of the kingdom's land area and population) on behalf of the entire kingdom, with
Aruba, CuraÃ§ao, and Sint Maarten being dependent on the Netherlands.

The vast majority of the country of the Netherlands is located in Europe, with
the exception of its three special municipalities (Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and
Saba) that are located in the Caribbean. The countries of Aruba, CuraÃ§ao, and
Sint Maarten are located in the Caribbean as well.
